form.label: Bucket Size Detail
form.searchTemplate: earliest=@d `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | fields id, sizeOnDiskMB, path, index

html.div:
This dashboard shows the size of buckets within an index. More information about indexes and buckets in general can be found here.
Within the panel titled Maximum Bucket Size, two values are shown. The first, labeled "Setting" is the value that appears as the configuration setting maxDataSize within indexes.conf for this index. It is quite common to use a value of either auto or auto_high_volume for this parameter. These values scale depending upon the number of bits in the host's underlying operating system. To understand the actual applied value of the setting for this system, look to the value labeled "Applied".

input.label: Host
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | dedup orig_host | sort orig_host

input.label: Index
input.populatingSearch: | inputlookup fb_hostname_index_cache | search orig_host=$host$ | dedup orig_index | sort orig_index

single.title: Bucket Count for This Index
single.searchPostProcess: stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats count

single.title: Average Bucket Size
single.searchPostProcess: stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats avg(sizeOnDiskMB) AS average | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(average)`

single.searchString: | `_fb_rest_index_config($host$, $index$)` | join type=left splunk_server [ | rest /services/server/info splunk_server=$host$ ] | eval bucket_max=if(maxDataSize=="auto", 750, if(maxDataSize=="auto_high_volume", case(cpu_arch=="x86_64", 10000, cpu_arch=="x64", 10000, 1==1, 1000), maxDataSize)) | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(bucket_max)`

chart.title: Bucket Sizes with Overlay, Local Buckets Only
chart.searchPostProcess: extract auto=f fb_extract_bucket_type_time_source | search NOT bucket_type="rb" | eventstats avg(sizeOnDiskMB) AS average | sort 0 id | join type=left index [ | `_fb_rest_index_config($host$, $index$)` ] | join type=left splunk_server [ | rest /services/server/info | fields - id ] | eval bucket_max=case(isint(maxDataSize), maxDataSize, maxDataSize=="auto", 750, cpu_arch="x86_64", 10000, cpu_arch="x64", 10000, 1==1, 1000) | table id, sizeOnDiskMB, average, bucket_max | rename sizeOnDiskMB AS "Bucket Size", average AS "Average Size", bucket_max AS "Size Limit"
